events.message: Customer reported a car accident involving their vehicle on May 1st, requesting to file an official insurance claim.
The claim has been classified under Auto Accident due to keywords indicating a collision with another vehicle.
An agent specializing in auto accident claims was assigned to the customer's case to ensure proper handling and follow-up.
The company sent an acknowledgment receipt to the customer confirming the claim submission and outlining the next steps.
Customer was requested to submit a police report, photos of the damage, and a copy of their driver's license for processing.
All requested documents, including the accident police report and vehicle damage photographs, were received from the claimant.
An investigation team was assigned to review the claim details, verify damages, and assess liability for the reported collision.
The investigation concluded confirming the accident details align with the claimant's description and the damage assessment.
A settlement offer was communicated to the customer including coverage details and estimated compensation for repairs.
The customer confirmed satisfaction with the proposed settlement amount and requested to proceed with the payment.
The claim was formally approved by the insurance manager following customer agreement to the settlement terms.
Payment for the approved claim was processed and issued to the customer’s bank account promptly as agreed.
The auto accident claim case was closed formally after the payment, with confirmation sent to the insured party.
All documents and case files related to the auto accident claim were archived in the company’s secure database.
